title: Highest Employment Rate
description: Kazakhstan has one of the highest employment rates in the world, with 95.1% of the population aged 15 and over employed as of 2022.

title: Lowest Prevalence of Severe Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, only 0.6% of Kazakhstan's population experienced severe food insecurity, one of the lowest rates globally.

title: High Educational Attainment
description: As of 2018, 79.02% of Kazakhstan's population aged 25 and over had completed at least post-secondary education, indicating a high level of educational attainment.

title: Low Population Living in Slums
description: In 2020, only 0.79% of Kazakhstan's urban population lived in slums, reflecting a low rate of urban poverty.

title: High Arable Land Per Person
description: Kazakhstan had 1.50 hectares of arable land per person in 2021, one of the highest ratios in the world.

title: High Taxes on Exports
description: In 2023, Kazakhstan imposed taxes on exports amounting to 2,135,352,265,935.25 local currency units, one of the highest globally.

title: Low Proportion Living Below 50% of Median Income
description: Only 3.1% of Kazakhstan's population lived below 50% of the median income in 2021, indicating low income inequality.
